task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 187°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I am currently facing the target building at approximately 188°, but I need to look up to see its full height from ground to roof for accurate estimation.
I have rotated upward but am no longer facing the target building; I must reorient to face south (187°) while maintaining an upward pitch to estimate the building’s height.
I am now facing the target building at 187° with a 30° upward pitch, allowing me to see its upper structure; I will look further up to capture the full height from ground to roof for estimation.
I have lost orientation toward the target building; I must rotate back to face south (187°) while keeping an upward pitch to continue estimating the building’s full height.

I am correctly oriented toward the target building at 187° with a 30° upward pitch, and I can now visually estimate its full height from ground to roof based on visible architectural features and scale cues.
